text.text_translated:
In the 1950s, people who grew and sold bananas in Central America had a big problem. Their most important product for making money was the Gros Michel banana. People also called it Big Mike. This banana was dying.

Now, the same thing is happening again. It is happening to the Cavendish banana. The Cavendish banana is the one that replaced Big Mike.

The Gros Michel banana was very popular. It was easy to move, had thick skin, and was sweet. It was the main banana on almost all the big farms in Central America.

A company called United Fruit grew these bananas. It was the main grower in South America at that time. It found a good, fast way to grow them. They grew huge numbers of bananas quickly and cheaply. They did not grow new plants from seeds. Instead, they cloned them by taking parts from old plants. They grew these new plants very close together in the fields.

best_attempt.text_translated:
In the 1950s, commercial banana growers in Central America had a big problem. Their most important product for making money was the Gros Michel banana. People also called it Big Mike. This banana was dying.

Now, the same thing is happening again. It is happening to the Cavendish banana. The Cavendish banana is the one that replaced Big Mike.

The Gros Michel banana was very popular. It was easy to move, had thick skin, and was sweet. It was the main banana on almost all the big farms in Central America.

A company called United Fruit grew these bananas. It was the main grower in South America at that time. It found an efficient way to mass-produce them. This means they grew huge numbers of bananas quickly and cheaply. They did not grow new plants from seeds. Instead, they cloned them by taking parts from old plants. They grew these new plants very close together in the fields.
